content.question: A student adds <math alttext="50.0 grams" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of liquid water at <math alttext="25.0 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25.0</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to an insulated container fitted with a temperature probe. The student then adds <math alttext="10.0 grams" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of ice at <math alttext="0.0 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.0</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, closes the container, and measures the temperature at different intervals. Part of the data is shown in the graph above. The student predicts that the temperature will continue to decrease then level out to a constant temperature. Which of the following best explains why the student’s prediction is correct?

choices.label: The <math alttext="H 2 O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules initially in the ice and the molecules initially in the liquid will have the same average kinetic energy.

The transfer of energy between the <math alttext="H 2 O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules in the ice and liquid water stops once all the molecules are in the liquid phase.

Once all of the <math alttext="H 2 O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules are in the liquid phase, the individual molecular speeds either increase or decrease until all the particles have the same speed.

Once all of the <math alttext="H 2 O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules are in the liquid phase, collisions between them virtually stop as they reach an equilibrium distance from their neighboring molecules.

content.answer: The <math alttext="H 2 O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules initially in the ice and the molecules initially in the liquid will have the same average kinetic energy.
